poem:
**The Future I See**

In panels inked with foresight,  
cities shiver and plates converge.  
Travelers hesitate over breakfast,  
imagining tremors beneath their feet.  
Stories rooted in fiction sprout  
into fields of doubt and deferred plans—  
as shinkansen slide through pages,  
whispering words never spoken:  
stay or go, the earth holds secrets  
in every new day and every old line.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Holiday bookings to Japan are down - could a 90s manga comic’s earthquake prediction be to blame? A grim prediction made in a manga first published a quarter of a century ago is being blamed for a dramatic fall in holiday bookings to Japan from several Asian countries. Flight reservations to Japan from some of its key tourism markets have reportedly plummeted, with some linking the fall to The Future I Saw, a Japanese graphic". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
